OmeroScreen Plots
  • CombPlot API
  • Edit on GitHub

CombPlot API

The combplot module creates combined visualizations with marginal distributions for exploring relationships between features.

Main Functions

omero_screen_plots.combplot.comb_plot(df: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], feature_col: str, feature_y_lim: float, condition_col: str = 'condition', selector_col: str | None = 'cell_line', selector_val: str | None = None, title: str | None = None, cell_number: int | None = None, colors: list[str] = ['#526C94', '#D8C367', '#75B1CE', '#DC6B83', '#D4D3CF', '#00bfb2', '#CCDBA2', '#889466', '#C6B2D1', '#654875'], fig_size: tuple[float, float] = (10, 7), size_units: str = 'cm', save: bool = True, path: Path | None = None) → None[source]

Plot a combined histogram and scatter plot.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – pd.DataFrame containing the data to plot.

  • conditions (list[str]) – list[str] containing the conditions to plot.

  • feature_col (str) – str containing the column to plot.

  • feature_y_lim (float) – float containing the threshold for color categorization.

  • condition_col (str) – str containing the column indicating experimental condition.

  • selector_col (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the column indicating the cell line.

  • df – pd.DataFrame containing the data to plot.

  • conditions – list[str] containing the conditions to plot.

  • feature_col – str containing the column to plot.

  • feature_y_lim – float containing the threshold for color categorization.

  • condition_col – str containing the column indicating experimental condition.

  • selector_col – Optional[str] containing the column indicating the cell line.

  • selector_val (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the value of the cell line to plot.

  • title (str | None) – str | None containing the title of the plot.

  • cell_number (int | None) – int | None containing the number of cells to plot.

  • colors (list[str]) – list[str] containing the colors to use for the plot.

  • fig_size (tuple[float, float]) – tuple[float, float] containing the size of the figure.

  • size_units (str) – str containing the units of the figure size.

  • save (bool) – bool containing whether to save the plot.

  • path (Path | None) – Path | None containing the path to save the plot.

Return type:

None

omero_screen_plots.combplot.combplot_simple(df: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], condition_col: str = 'condition', selector_col: str | None = 'cell_line', selector_val: str | None = None, title: str | None = None, cell_number: int | None = None, colors: list[str] = ['#526C94', '#D8C367', '#75B1CE', '#DC6B83', '#D4D3CF', '#00bfb2', '#CCDBA2', '#889466', '#C6B2D1', '#654875'], fig_size: tuple[float, float] = (10, 7), size_units: str = 'cm', save: bool = True, path: Path | None = None, H3: bool = False) → None[source]

Plot a combined histogram, scatter plot, and a stacked barplot as the last column.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – pd.DataFrame containing the data to plot.

  • conditions (list[str]) – list[str] containing the conditions to plot.

  • condition_col (str) – str containing the column indicating experimental condition.

  • selector_col (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the column indicating the cell line.

  • selector_val (Optional[str]) – Optional[str] containing the value of the cell line to plot.

  • title (str | None) – str | None containing the title of the plot.

  • cell_number (int | None) – int | None containing the number of cells to plot.

  • colors (list[str]) – list[str] containing the colors to use for the plot.

  • fig_size (tuple[float, float]) – tuple[float, float] containing the size of the figure.

  • size_units (str) – str containing the units of the figure size.

  • save (bool) – bool containing whether to save the plot.

  • path (Path | None) – Path | None containing the path to save the plot.

  • H3 (bool) – bool containing whether to use H3 cell cycle phases.

Return type:

None

omero_screen_plots.combplot.histogram_plot(ax: Axes, i: int, data: DataFrame, colors: list[str] = ['#526C94', '#D8C367', '#75B1CE', '#DC6B83', '#D4D3CF', '#00bfb2', '#CCDBA2', '#889466', '#C6B2D1', '#654875']) → None[source]

Plot a histogram of the integrated DAPI intensity.

Return type:

None

Parameters

axAxes

The axes on which to plot the histogram.

iint

The index of the histogram (used for labeling).

datapd.DataFrame

The data containing the integrated DAPI intensity.

colorslist[str]

A list of colors to use for the histogram.

Returns:

None

This function does not return a value.

omero_screen_plots.combplot.scatter_plot(ax: Axes, i: int, data: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], colors: list[str]) → None[source]

Plot a scatter plot of the integrated DAPI intensity vs. the mean EdU intensity.

Return type:

None

Parameters

axplt.Axes

The axes on which to plot the scatter plot.

iint

The index of the scatter plot (used for labeling).

datapd.DataFrame

The data containing the integrated DAPI intensity and mean EdU intensity.

conditionslist[str]

The conditions to use for the scatter plot.

colorslist[str]

A list of colors to use for the scatter plot.

Returns:

None

This function does not return a value.

omero_screen_plots.combplot.scatter_plot_feature(ax: Axes, i: int, data: DataFrame, conditions: list[str], col: str, y_lim: float, colors: list[str] = ['#526C94', '#D8C367', '#75B1CE', '#DC6B83', '#D4D3CF', '#00bfb2', '#CCDBA2', '#889466', '#C6B2D1', '#654875']) → None[source]

Plot a scatter plot of the integrated DAPI intensity vs. a specified column.

Return type:

None

Parameters

axplt.Axes

The axes on which to plot the scatter plot.

iint

The index of the scatter plot (used for labeling).

datapd.DataFrame

The data containing the integrated DAPI intensity and the specified column.

conditionslist[str]

The conditions to use for the scatter plot.

colstr

The column to plot against the integrated DAPI intensity.

y_limfloat

The threshold value for color categorization.

colorslist[str]

A list of colors to use for the scatter plot.

Examples

Combined plot with automatic styling:

from omero_screen_plots.combplot import comb_plot

comb_plot(
    data_path="sample_plate_data.csv",
    plot_type="scatter",
    conditions=["DMSO", "Nutlin"],
    condition_col="condition",
    x_feature="intensity_integrated_dapi_nucleus",
    y_feature="intensity_mean_edu_nucleus",
    output_path="output/"
)

Simple combined plot:

from omero_screen_plots.combplot import combplot_simple

combplot_simple(
    data_path="sample_plate_data.csv",
    plot_type="histogram",
    conditions=["DMSO", "Nutlin", "Etop", "Noc"],
    condition_col="condition",
    x_feature="area_nucleus",
    output_path="output/",
    fig_id="nuclear_area_distribution"
)

Histogram plot:

from omero_screen_plots.combplot import histogram_plot
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv("sample_plate_data.csv")
fig, ax = histogram_plot(
    df=df,
    conditions=["DMSO", "Nutlin"],
    condition_col="condition",
    x_feature="intensity_mean_p21_nucleus",
    bins=50
)

Scatter plot with feature relationship:

from omero_screen_plots.combplot import scatter_plot_feature

scatter_plot_feature(
    data_path="sample_plate_data.csv",
    conditions=["DMSO", "Nutlin"],
    condition_col="condition",
    x_feature="intensity_integrated_dapi_nucleus",
    y_feature="intensity_mean_edu_nucleus",
    output_path="output/"
)
